result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Michael Lach-Cook

defendant.name: Lach-Cook, Jacob Michael
defendant.address: 7940 South Wildwood Drive  #4, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt: Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION; all other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue.

FOR BRANCH 15
Defendant Jacob Michael Lach-Cook in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Jacob Michael Lach-Cook.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on warrant. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court orders signature bond sets at $1500.00; Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION. All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15. Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Warrant/Capias/Commitment canceled; Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Jacob Michael Lach-Cook.  Attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Status Conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court orders bench warrant to issue for the defendant.  The Court ordered that the defendant is to be REMANDED to the commissioner upon return on the bench warrant.  The Court ordered any bail on deposit forfeited.

Defendant Jacob Michael Lach-Cook not in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Jacob Michael Lach-Cook.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record via Zoom. Statements by defense as to defendants non appearance. State has no objection to Court waiving defendant's appearance for today's proceedings. Defendant has a pending cas 22CF2658 in Branch 36. Defense requests a status conference date.  Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jacob Michael Lach-Cook in court with Attorney Haley E Wentz.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for pretrial conference.  Court set a scheduling conference date.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (7/2/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.L.C.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jacob Michael Lach-Cook in court.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kori Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-30-2022 @1:30p
